subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unicode and J-Unit and Eclipse
messageBody:
I'd start with the textual runner:

|java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests

Good luck,

David Saff
|
speedracer1548 wrote:

> I expect them to pass. The actual shows up as how I wanted and that
> is correct if I were to verify it manually. The expected part is
> coming out corrupted causing my test to fail. I can run the program
> application itself VIA command prompt. It has one functionality
> that outputs whatever is in a textfile you specify. I then used my
> "Expected Values.in" file and it output correctly in command prompt.
>
> I think there are some gritty issues in J-Unit. I remember using J-
> Unit with the UI via command prompt, but after coming across Eclipse
> (making it so much easier to run), I forgot how to do so. Does
> anyone remember how to? It will tell me whether or not Eclipse is a
> part of this issue.
>
> My assert looks like this:
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@m...> wrote:
> > speedracer,
> >
> > Do you expect these tests to fail (with non-corrupted data), or do
> you
> > expect them to pass, but the corruption causes them to fail? If
> the
> > second, it's very unlikely that Eclipse is to blame. You might
> want to
> > take Eclipse and JUnit out of the picture by writing a small
> program
> > whose main procedure reads your input.in files and prints them out
> to
> > the console, or compares them to literal unicode strings. If that
> > program works as expected, then perhaps the gremlins are hiding in
> > Eclipse or JUnit--let us know.
> >
> > David Saff
> >
> > speedracer1548 wrote:
> >
> > > Hi,
> > >
> > > I've been interested in using J-unit for globalization testing. I
> > > have used J-Unit before, but never in this way. I want to use J-
> Unit
> > > to verify Japanese characters in resource bundles. I am using
> Eclipse
> > > to run J-Unit. I am also using input.in files to use as
> the "Expected"
> > > Data. I correctly grab the "Actual" data as Eclispe shows me
> this,
> > > but the "Expected" data comes out corrupted.
> > >
> > > For those of you who know locale region settings, I am in
> Japanese in
> > > all of them and my input.in file correctly displays Japanese
> > > characters, the only problem I'm facing is with J-Unit. See the
> > > attached screenshot for clarification. The SS shows the input
> file
> > > with "Expected" data, and also shows the character corruption
> from
> > > Eclipse.
> > >
> > > Is this problem related to J-Unit or Eclipse, or something else?
> > >
> > >
> http://img400.imageshack.us/img400/1391/junitcharcorruption1zf.jpg
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
